Node.definition: = state in which a countable entity is the ninth in a range

= man; ◄ third son of Josiah (יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ) former name was Mattaniah (מַתַּנְיָה) ► described as one who did evil in the sight of the Lord; uncle of King Jehoiachin (יְהֹויָכִין) Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר) of Babylon (בָּבֶל) appointed him king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (597 587) following Jehoiachin's rebellion; he too rebelled against Babylon and was eventually taken captive to Babylon, his sons were killed and his own eyes put out; contemporary of Jeremiah (יִרְמְיָהוּ)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

= an organized military force equipped for fighting on land; this term denotes primarily the foot soldiers, though it can also be used to refer to the entire fighting force, including chariots and horsemen
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

= action by which a group of humans gather around a town with an army and surround it ► with the purpose of forcing it to surrender by cutting off all supplies, or by attacking it directly with the help of siege works
= state in which a countable object is eleven or the eleventh in number

= man; ◄ third son of Josiah (יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ) former name was Mattaniah (מַתַּנְיָה) ► described as one who did evil in the sight of the Lord; uncle of King Jehoiachin (יְהֹויָכִין) Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר) of Babylon (בָּבֶל) appointed him king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (597 587) following Jehoiachin's rebellion; he too rebelled against Babylon and was eventually taken captive to Babylon, his sons were killed and his own eyes put out; contemporary of Jeremiah (יִרְמְיָהוּ)
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= state in which a countable entity is the fourth in a range
= state in which a countable entity is nine in number
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

Node.gloss: to be split|to be cleft|to be breached|to be cracked|to be ripped open|to be rent|to burst asunder
Node.definition: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
= man; ► official; time of king Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר)
= man; ► official; time of king Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר)
= man; ► official; time of king Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר)
literally: great one; hence: = someone in a position of authority at a royal court or on a ship
= a high ranking and trusted officer of the king who serves in the royal palace
= man; ► official; time of king Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר)
literally: great one; hence: = someone in a position of authority at a royal court or on a ship
= the title of a high official in the Babylonian army
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= man; ◄ third son of Josiah (יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ) former name was Mattaniah (מַתַּנְיָה) ► described as one who did evil in the sight of the Lord; uncle of King Jehoiachin (יְהֹויָכִין) Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר) of Babylon (בָּבֶל) appointed him king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (597 587) following Jehoiachin's rebellion; he too rebelled against Babylon and was eventually taken captive to Babylon, his sons were killed and his own eyes put out; contemporary of Jeremiah (יִרְמְיָהוּ)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
literally: a person of battle; hence: = a person that is of age and physically able to bear arms
= action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
literally: road; hence: = a location that needs to be passed to get from one place to another
= a location in Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= the area separating two or mores locations

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
literally: road; hence: = a location that needs to be passed to get from one place to another

= an organized military force equipped for fighting on land; this term denotes primarily the foot soldiers, though it can also be used to refer to the entire fighting force, including chariots and horsemen
= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is located or takes place behind Y
= action by which humans succeed to catch up with other humans after having pursued them

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= man; ◄ third son of Josiah (יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ) former name was Mattaniah (מַתַּנְיָה) ► described as one who did evil in the sight of the Lord; uncle of King Jehoiachin (יְהֹויָכִין) Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר) of Babylon (בָּבֶל) appointed him king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (597 587) following Jehoiachin's rebellion; he too rebelled against Babylon and was eventually taken captive to Babylon, his sons were killed and his own eyes put out; contemporary of Jeremiah (יִרְמְיָהוּ)
= town; ◄ located northwest of the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► first town conquered by Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) after they entered Canaan (כְּנַעַן)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= town, also known as Diblah (דִּבְלָה) ◄ on the Orontes river, in Syria

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= town, area; ◄ on Orontes river in Syria (אֲרָם) ► capital of Aramean (אֲרַמִּי) kingdom; its inhabitants were relocated to Samaria (שֹׁמְרֹון) by the king of Assyria (אַשּׁוּר)

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= the outcome of a dispute between two or more parties, decided by a judge or a deity
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man; ◄ third son of Josiah (יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ) former name was Mattaniah (מַתַּנְיָה) ► described as one who did evil in the sight of the Lord; uncle of King Jehoiachin (יְהֹויָכִין) Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר) of Babylon (בָּבֶל) appointed him king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (597 587) following Jehoiachin's rebellion; he too rebelled against Babylon and was eventually taken captive to Babylon, his sons were killed and his own eyes put out; contemporary of Jeremiah (יִרְמְיָהוּ)
= town, also known as Diblah (דִּבְלָה) ◄ on the Orontes river, in Syria

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= person; ◄ belonging to the social class of the nobility ► and therefore often found in a position of authority; ≈ usually treated with respect

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= man; ◄ third son of Josiah (יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ) former name was Mattaniah (מַתַּנְיָה) ► described as one who did evil in the sight of the Lord; uncle of King Jehoiachin (יְהֹויָכִין) Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר) of Babylon (בָּבֶל) appointed him king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (597 587) following Jehoiachin's rebellion; he too rebelled against Babylon and was eventually taken captive to Babylon, his sons were killed and his own eyes put out; contemporary of Jeremiah (יִרְמְיָהוּ)
= literally: to blind (one's) eyes; hence: = to cause someone to be unable to see by destroying or putting out their eyes
= causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects
= causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

literally: great one; hence: = someone in a position of authority at a royal court or on a ship
= elite group of soldiers ► responsible for protecting high ranking officials or commanders; ≈ possibly carried the pejorative connotation that butchers can have in referring to ruthless soldiers
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= a reference to any object

literally: great one; hence: = someone in a position of authority at a royal court or on a ship
= elite group of soldiers ► responsible for protecting high ranking officials or commanders; ≈ possibly carried the pejorative connotation that butchers can have in referring to ruthless soldiers

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= field where grapes (עֲנָב) are cultivated, growing on vines (גֶּפֶן) typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a watchtower (מִגְדָּל) and a wine press (יֶקֶב)
= portion of land used for agriculture

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= man; ◄ son of Hilkiah (חִלְקִיָּה) ► prophet (נָבִיא)
literally: by the hand (of someone); hence: = process by which a certain event is carried out by an intermediary (person) or instrument (object)
= man; ► captain of the bodyguard of king Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר)
literally: great one; hence: = someone in a position of authority at a royal court or on a ship
= elite group of soldiers ► responsible for protecting high ranking officials or commanders; ≈ possibly carried the pejorative connotation that butchers can have in referring to ruthless soldiers

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

literally: to place (one's) eyes (on someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities pay special attention to (other) humans, ◄ as if they were keeping their eyes on them at all times; ≈ this can be understood both in a positive and a negative sense

= causative action by which humans or deities send one or more people though the people sent are not mentioned explicitly to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man; ◄ son of Hilkiah (חִלְקִיָּה) ► prophet (נָבִיא)
= area enclosed by walls or buildings

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man; ◄ son of Ahikam (אֲחִיקָם) ► governor of Judah (יְהוּדָה) time of exile
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Shaphan (שָׁפָן) ► official; time of king Josiah (יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ) father of Gedaliah (גְּדַלְיָהוּ) governor of Judah (יְהוּדָה) time of exile
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Azaliah (אֲצַלְיָהוּ) ► secretary; time of king Josiah (יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ)

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= man; ◄ son of Hilkiah (חִלְקִיָּה) ► prophet (נָבִיא)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans put other humans in a position by which they can no longer move at will
= area enclosed by walls or buildings

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ Cushite (כּוּשִׁי) ► eunuch (סָרִיס) time of king Zedekiah (צִדְקִיָּהוּ) who saved Jeremiah (יִרְמְיָהוּ) from a cistern (בֹּור)
= member of the ethnic group ◄ that is regarded as descendants of Cush, son of Ham (חָם)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= state in which humans are in a state of fear in the face of imminent danger
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans are killed or severely wounded by enemies

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
